content:
I've been enjoying the language course so far! It's been helpful in navigating everyday situations in Paris, and I've even started to understand some French TV shows and movies. I've had some funny moments, like when I accidentally used the wrong verb conjugation in a conversation and ended up confusing my French friend!

I'll definitely take your advice and start learning some basic Dutch phrases before my trip to Amsterdam. I've heard the Dutch pronunciation can be tricky, but I'm up for the challenge.

As for my Amsterdam itinerary, I'd love some recommendations! I've heard about the Anne Frank House and the Rijksmuseum, but I'm not sure what else to prioritize. Are there any hidden gems or local favorites that I shouldn't miss?
